abstract: Much ink has been spilled on the banks that topped last year’s league tables (Goldman Sachs and Citigroup), but what about the losers? In a year when securities firms collected a record $36.7 billion for arranging stock and bond offerings, UBS and Deutsche Bank got left behind. Fees earned by the two banks climbed at less than half the pace of the world’s 25 top underwriters, which collectively posted a 23 percent increase in commissions in 2006, data compiled by Bloomberg News show.
lead_paragraph: Much ink has been spilled on the banks that topped last year’s league tables (Goldman Sachs and Citigroup), but what about the losers? In a year when securities firms collected a record $36.7 billion for arranging stock and bond offerings, UBS and Deutsche Bank got left behind. Fees earned by the two banks climbed at less than half the pace of the world’s 25 top underwriters, which collectively posted a 23 percent increase in commissions in 2006, data compiled by Bloomberg News show.

headline.main: In Year of Record Fees, UBS and Deutsche Get Left Behind
